@snps/ui

Comprehensive vanilla TypeScript UI component library with 600+ bulletproof components for Synapse framework

v1.0.0 100% coverage

Classes

SynapseUI

Main UI library class with component management and theming

Singleton 100% coverage

Methods

createComponent(name: string, props: Record)

Create a component by name with props

mount(component: HTMLElement, container: string | HTMLElement)

Mount a component to the DOM

setTheme(theme: string)

Set the current theme

Properties

theme: string

Current theme name

ComponentFactory

Factory for creating and registering components

Factory 100% coverage

Methods

register(name: string, factory: ComponentFactoryFunction)

Register a component factory

create(name: string, props: Record)

Create a component by name

Properties

Examples

Basic UI Component Usage

Create and use UI components in your application

typescript beginner 5 min Runnable Interactive 
import { createComponent, mount, setTheme } from '@snps/ui';

// Create a button component
const button = createComponent('Button', {
  variant: 'primary',
  size: 'md',
  children: 'Click me!',
  onClick: () => alert('Hello World!')
});

// Mount to DOM
mount(button, '#app');

// Set theme
setTheme('dark');

Form with Validation

Create a form with input validation using UI components

typescript intermediate 10 min Runnable Interactive 
import { createComponent, mount } from '@snps/ui';

// Create form components
const form = createComponent('Container', {
  children: [
    createComponent('Heading', {
      level: 2,
      children: 'Contact Form'
    }),
    createComponent('Input', {
      label: 'Name',
      placeholder: 'Enter your name',
      required: true,
      error: false,
      helpText: 'This field is required'
    }),
    createComponent('Input', {
      inputType: 'email',
      label: 'Email',
      placeholder: 'Enter your email',
      required: true
    }),
    createComponent('Button', {
      variant: 'primary',
      children: 'Submit',
      buttonType: 'submit'
    })
  ]
});

mount(form, '#form-container');
